other_tests.findings: Duodenal-biopsy specimens showed villous blunting, active inflammation, and intraepithelial lymphocytes, consistent with celiac disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings indicated extensive inflammation in the small and large bowel on subsequent admissions, consistent with strongyloides hyperinfection.

other_tests.findings: Colonic-biopsy specimens showed marked chronic inflammatory changes, without granulomas.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings transitioned to extensive areas of inflammation in the entire colon with deep, serpiginous ulcerations indicating progression in the pathology.

other_tests.findings: Numerous rhabditiform larvae and a few filariform larvae of S. stercoralis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial stool examinations 4 years prior had no detectable parasitoid presence, indicating a significant increase in the parasitic load.

other_tests.findings: Marked erythema, edema, and villous blunting in the distal duodenum and jejunum; extensive inflammation in the colon.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings progressed from earlier biopsies indicating inflammation to severe involvement of the intestines suggesting hyperinfection.
